REST API repository Contacts¶

class contacts.controllers.ContactController¶

Bases: object

base_model¶

alias of Contact

async create(user: User, body: ContactModel, db: Session) → Contact¶

Creates a new contact for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – The data for the contact to create.

  • user (User) – The user to create the note for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

Contact

async delete(user: User, id: int, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Removes a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • id (int) – The ID of the contact to remove.

  • user (User) – The user to remove the note for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The removed contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async list(q: str, skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific user with specified pagination parameters.

Parameters:

  • q (str) – query string

  • skip (int) – The number of notes to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of notes to return.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve notes for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async read(user: User, id: int, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Retrieves a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve the note for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The contact with the specified ID, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async upcoming_birthdays(user: User, db: Session, days: int = 7) → List[Contact]¶
async update(user: User, id: int, body: ContactModel, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Updates a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • body (NoteUpdate) – The updated data for the note.

  • user (User) – The user to update the note for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

  • db (Session) – The database session.
